turns.content: give me step by step instruction to create an environment in conda using command line, and how to install python jupyter notebook. and finally add the environment to kernel in jupyter notebooks.

Sure, here are the step-by-step instructions to create a new environment in Conda using the command line, install Jupyter Notebook, and add the environment to the kernel in Jupyter Notebooks:

1. Open your command prompt or terminal window.
2. Make sure that you have Conda installed. If you don't have Conda installed, you can download and install it from the official Conda website.
3. To create a new environment, type the following command in your command prompt or terminal window:
```lua
conda create --name myenv
```
Replace "myenv" with the name of your environment.
4. Once the environment is created, activate it by typing the following command:
```
conda activate myenv
```
Replace "myenv" with the name of your environment.
5. Install Jupyter Notebook by typing the following command:
```
conda install jupyter
```
6. Once Jupyter Notebook is installed, you can start it by typing the following command:
```
jupyter notebook
```
This will launch Jupyter Notebook in your web browser.
7. To add the environment to the kernel in Jupyter Notebook, you need to install the ipykernel package. Type the following command:
```
conda install ipykernel
```
8. Once ipykernel is installed, you can add the environment to the kernel by typing the following command:
```css
python -m ipykernel install --user --name=myenv
```
Replace "myenv" with the name of your environment.
9. After adding the environment to the kernel, you can open Jupyter Notebook again by typing:
```
jupyter notebook
```
Once you open Jupyter Notebook, you should see your environment listed in the kernel options when creating a new notebook.

That's it! You've successfully created a new environment in Conda, installed Jupyter Notebook, and added the environment to the kernel in Jupyter Notebook.
